title: Revealing variants in SARS-CoV-2 interaction domain of ACE2 and loss of function intolerance through analysis of >200,000 exomes
author: Elizabeth T. Cirulli,​ *,Stephen Riffle,​ ,Alexandre Bolze,​ ,Nicole L. Washington,​ 1Helix, 101 S Ellsworth Ave Suite 350, San Mateo, California 94401
abstract:
In conclusion, there is moderate evidence that ACE2 variation is associated with gastro-oesophageal reflux disease with oesophagitis, and limited evidence of it having a strong role in other phenotypes in the absence of COVID-19. Homo/hemizygous LoF of ACE2​ appears to be infrequently tolerated and is likely extremely deleterious. Although LoF variants in ACE2​ are extremely rare, variants affecting the regions that interact with SARS-CoV-2 are more prevalent, and the impending research studies on human genetics and COVID-19 response may identify some of these variants as conferring resistance or heightened susceptibility to the virus.
